NoNavigation.helpDescription: Like the Standard Area but without top-level navigation bar.
NoNavigation.description: Like the Standard Area but without top-level navigation bar.

SlimNavigation.helpDescription: Like the Standard Area but with a leaner top-level navigation bar.
SlimNavigation.description: Like the Standard Area but with a leaner top-level navigation bar.

BrandOnly.helpDescription: Only the branding area is visible. Top-level navigation bar, header items, title and icon are not shown.
BrandOnly.description: Only the branding area is visible. Top-level navigation bar, header items, title and icon are not shown.

Horizontal.helpDescription: The header content is displayed horizontally above the facet content
Horizontal.description: The header content is displayed horizontally above the facet content

Crystal.helpDescription:
An even lighter design. It borrows most of its properties from the Light
design and just changes a few details like the header colors in order to
have a blue design within gold reflection.
Crystal.description:
An even lighter design. It borrows most of its properties from the Light
design and just changes a few details like the header colors in order to
have a blue design within gold reflection.

Light.helpDescription:
A lighter design. Should be used in combination with the Standard header
type.
Light.description:
A lighter design. Should be used in combination with the Standard header
type.

Select.helpDescription: The order of the sub lists is defined by the selection order of the user.
Select.description: The order of the sub lists is defined by the selection order of the user.

Fixed.helpDescription: The order of the sub lists is defined by order of the defined sub attributes.
Fixed.description: The order of the sub lists is defined by order of the defined sub attributes.

Auto.helpDescription: The FacetFilter automatically fills the height of the surrounding container. The visibleItemCount property is automatically changed accordingly.
Auto.description: The FacetFilter automatically fills the height of the surrounding container. The visibleItemCount property is automatically changed accordingly.

Fixed.helpDescription: The FacetFilter always has as many items in the FacetFilterList as defined in the visibleItemCount property.
Fixed.description: The FacetFilter always has as many items in the FacetFilterList as defined in the visibleItemCount property.

colspan.helpDescription: If Group is used in a column layout the groups spans the all columns if set to true.
colspan.description: If Group is used in a column layout the groups spans the all columns if set to true.

sap.ui.ux3.OverlayContainer.helpDescription: Is to be embedded into the Overlay control as content container
sap.ui.ux3.OverlayContainer.description: Is to be embedded into the Overlay control as content container

closeButtonVisible.helpDescription: Defines whether the 'Close' button shall be visible
closeButtonVisible.description: Defines whether the 'Close' button shall be visible

openButtonVisible.helpDescription: Defines whether the 'Open' button shall be visible
openButtonVisible.description: Defines whether the 'Open' button shall be visible

sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute.helpDescription: An element for defining attributes and sub-attributes used within the Exact pattern.

supplyAttributes.helpDescription: A supply function is a handler which is attached to the supplyAttributes event. The event is fired when the corresponding ExactAttribute is selected, it was already selected when a handler is attached or function getAttributes() is called.
supplyAttributes.description: A supply function is a handler which is attached to the supplyAttributes event. The event is fired when the corresponding ExactAttribute is selected, it was already selected when a handler is attached or function getAttributes() is called.
supplyAttributes.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute.description: An element for defining attributes and sub-attributes used within the Exact pattern.

selected.helpDescription: Specifies whether the attribute shall be selected
selected.description: Specifies whether the attribute shall be selected

width.helpDescription: Specifies the width of the corresponding list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500.
width.description: Specifies the width of the corresponding list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500.

showSubAttributesIndicator.helpDescription:
Specifies whether the attribute shall have sub values for visual purposes.
The indicator which is a little arrow beside an attribute in the list is computed automatically
(getShowSubAttributesIndicator_Computed() of sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute).
In the case that a supply function is attached, and the supplyActive attribute has value 'true',
then the Exact pattern needs a hint if sub attributes are available. The showSubAttributesIndicator attribute is
considered then and has to be maintained. If the back-end does not support count-calls, for example,
showSubAttributesIndicator should be set to true.
showSubAttributesIndicator.description:
Specifies whether the attribute shall have sub values for visual purposes.
The indicator which is a little arrow beside an attribute in the list is computed automatically
(getShowSubAttributesIndicator_Computed() of sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute).
In the case that a supply function is attached, and the supplyActive attribute has value 'true',
then the Exact pattern needs a hint if sub attributes are available. The showSubAttributesIndicator attribute is
considered then and has to be maintained. If the back-end does not support count-calls, for example,
showSubAttributesIndicator should be set to true.

autoActivateSupply.helpDescription:
If you want the supply function to be called on every select, you can set the autoActivateSupply attribute to true. In this case, supplyActive is automatically
set to true on every unselect.
autoActivateSupply.description:
If you want the supply function to be called on every select, you can set the autoActivateSupply attribute to true. In this case, supplyActive is automatically
set to true on every unselect.

additionalData.helpDescription: An example for additional data are database keys
additionalData.description: An example for additional data are database keys

supplyActive.helpDescription:
The supplyAttributes event is only fired if supplyActive has value true which is the default. After firing the event, the attribute is automatically set to false.
The idea is that a supply function is called only once when the data is requested. To enable the event again it is possible to manually set the attribute back to true.
supplyActive.description:
The supplyAttributes event is only fired if supplyActive has value true which is the default. After firing the event, the attribute is automatically set to false.
The idea is that a supply function is called only once when the data is requested. To enable the event again it is possible to manually set the attribute back to true.

listOrder.helpDescription: The order how the sublists of this attribute should be displayed.
listOrder.description: The order how the sublists of this attribute should be displayed.

sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem.helpDescription: Is the item to be used within the NavigationBar
sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem.description: Is the item to be used within the NavigationBar

subItems.helpDescription: Any NavigationItems on the next hierarchy level connected to this NavigationItem
subItems.description: Any NavigationItems on the next hierarchy level connected to this NavigationItem

visible.helpDescription: Whether the NavigationItem is currently visible. When making NavigationItems invisible at runtime it is the application's responsibility to make sure it is not the currently selected one - or to select another one in this case.
visible.description: Whether the NavigationItem is currently visible. When making NavigationItems invisible at runtime it is the application's responsibility to make sure it is not the currently selected one - or to select another one in this case.

href.helpDescription:
Defines the link target URL. This property is optional and should only be set when required!
The use of the href property is to not only allow users to navigate in-place by left-clicking NavigationItems, but also to allow right-click and then "open in new tab" or "open in new window". As long as href is not set, an empty window will open and stay blank. But when href is set, the new window/tab will load this URL and it is the application's responsibility to display what the user expects (e.g. the Shell, with the respective NavigationItem being selected).
href.description:
Defines the link target URL. This property is optional and should only be set when required!
The use of the href property is to not only allow users to navigate in-place by left-clicking NavigationItems, but also to allow right-click and then "open in new tab" or "open in new window". As long as href is not set, an empty window will open and stay blank. But when href is set, the new window/tab will load this URL and it is the application's responsibility to display what the user expects (e.g. the Shell, with the respective NavigationItem being selected).

collectionSelected.helpDescription: Fires when an item in a collection is selected
collectionSelected.description: Fires when an item in a collection is selected
collectionSelected.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

editCollection.helpDescription: Fires when an item in a collection is selected
editCollection.description: Fires when an item in a collection is selected
editCollection.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

itemSelectionChanged.helpDescription: Fires when an item in a collection is selected
itemSelectionChanged.description: Fires when an item in a collection is selected
itemSelectionChanged.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

content.helpDescription: All controls that are currently displayed
content.description: All controls that are currently displayed

collections.helpDescription: Collections which are displayed in the COllectionInspector
collections.description: Collections which are displayed in the COllectionInspector

fitParent.helpDescription: If set to true, control will fit parents content area
fitParent.description: If set to true, control will fit parents content area

sidebarVisible.helpDescription: Defines if the list of collection items is visible on the left
sidebarVisible.description: Defines if the list of collection items is visible on the left

submit.helpDescription: Event is fired when the entered text is submitted
submit.description: Event is fired when the entered text is submitted
submit.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.Feeder.description:
This feed control flavor represents a lean common feed, or a comment feed, with a text commit function.
The control can be used stand alone or in a multiple way, and generally would be integrated directly into a UIArea.

text.helpDescription: The text for the Feeder. @References are supported.
text.description: The text for the Feeder. @References are supported.

thumbnailSrc.helpDescription:
URL to the thumb nail image
This property is optional if the feeder is a sub-control of a feed or a feedChunk control. In this case the value of the feed or feddChunk control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed or feedChunk control.
thumbnailSrc.description:
URL to the thumb nail image
This property is optional if the feeder is a sub-control of a feed or a feedChunk control. In this case the value of the feed or feddChunk control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed or feedChunk control.

placeholderText.helpDescription: This property could be used for costum placeholder. If it is not set, the default text is used.
placeholderText.description: This property could be used for costum placeholder. If it is not set, the default text is used.

type.helpDescription: Type and size of the Feeder
type.description: Type and size of the Feeder

sap.ui.ux3.DataSetSimpleView.helpDescription: DataSetSimpleView provides a simple view example for DataSet usage.
sap.ui.ux3.DataSetSimpleView.description: DataSetSimpleView provides a simple view example for DataSet usage.

reloadItemCount.helpDescription: This number defines the item count which is reloaded on scroll if initialItemCount is enabled.
reloadItemCount.description: This number defines the item count which is reloaded on scroll if initialItemCount is enabled.

initialItemCount.helpDescription: If this value is greater zero only this amount of items is loaded in the first place. New items are loaded automatically when the user scrolls down. The number of items which are reloaded can be defined with the property "reloadItemCount"
initialItemCount.description: If this value is greater zero only this amount of items is loaded in the first place. New items are loaded automatically when the user scrolls down. The number of items which are reloaded can be defined with the property "reloadItemCount"

height.helpDescription: If the pagination feature is used without specifying a scroll area, a height for the dataset must be defined.
height.description: If the pagination feature is used without specifying a scroll area, a height for the dataset must be defined.

itemMinWidth.helpDescription: When itemMinWidth>0 and the property floating is true the given minimum width in pixels is set to DatSet items. A minimum width must be given when the property responsive is set.
itemMinWidth.description: When itemMinWidth>0 and the property floating is true the given minimum width in pixels is set to DatSet items. A minimum width must be given when the property responsive is set.

responsive.helpDescription: When true and the property floating is true the DatSet items are floating containers filling the whole space of a row.
responsive.description: When true and the property floating is true the DatSet items are floating containers filling the whole space of a row.

floating.helpDescription: When true the DatSet items are floating containers. When set to false The Items are rendered in a 1 column Layout.
floating.description: When true the DatSet items are floating containers. When set to false The Items are rendered in a 1 column Layout.

scrollArea.helpDescription: ID of the DOM Element or jQuery reference to the dom which holds the scrollbar for the dataset
scrollArea.description: ID of the DOM Element or jQuery reference to the dom which holds the scrollbar for the dataset

sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.helpDescription:
Provides enhanced navigation capabilities and is the parent control of NavigationItem. It is displayed in the form of a horizontal line
with switching markers depending on the currently selected item. The size of an item which is currently chosen by the user is enlarged. In the case
that a large number of items are defined for the bar, this is made transparent to the user by showing symbols for scrolling options (forwards and backwards)
to see the next or previous items.

select.helpDescription: Event is fired when an item is selected by the user
select.description: Event is fired when an item is selected by the user
select.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.description:
Provides enhanced navigation capabilities and is the parent control of NavigationItem. It is displayed in the form of a horizontal line
with switching markers depending on the currently selected item. The size of an item which is currently chosen by the user is enlarged. In the case
that a large number of items are defined for the bar, this is made transparent to the user by showing symbols for scrolling options (forwards and backwards)
to see the next or previous items.

associatedItems.helpDescription:
This association is ignored as long as the items aggregation is used; and supposed to be used alternatively when the items should be aggregated by other
entities.
associatedItems.description:
This association is ignored as long as the items aggregation is used; and supposed to be used alternatively when the items should be aggregated by other
entities.

overflowMenu.helpDescription: Hidden aggregation for the overflow menu if applicable
overflowMenu.description: Hidden aggregation for the overflow menu if applicable

items.helpDescription:
If the navigation items need to have a different parent than the NavigationBar, alternatively the associatedItems association can be used.
The NavigationBar follows the approach to use the items aggregation. If this aggregation is empty, associatedItems is used.
items.description:
If the navigation items need to have a different parent than the NavigationBar, alternatively the associatedItems association can be used.
The NavigationBar follows the approach to use the items aggregation. If this aggregation is empty, associatedItems is used.

toplevelVariant.helpDescription: Defines whether the navigation bar shall have top-level appearance
toplevelVariant.description: Defines whether the navigation bar shall have top-level appearance

sap.ui.ux3.FacetFilterList.helpDescription: List to be used with the FacetFilter control. The control is not intended to be used stand alone.

select.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

controls.description: ListBoxes that are managed by this FacetFilterList

items.helpDescription: The filter values that are presented as a list.
items.description: The filter values that are presented as a list.

displaySecondaryValues.helpDescription: Specifies whether the text values from the additionalText property (see sap.ui.core.ListItems) shall be displayed.
displaySecondaryValues.description: Specifies whether the text values from the additionalText property (see sap.ui.core.ListItems) shall be displayed.

showCounter.helpDescription: Specifies whether the counter for all entries is shown.
showCounter.description: Specifies whether the counter for all entries is shown.

multiSelect.helpDescription: Specifies whether multiple or single selection is used.

filter.helpDescription: Filter control (e.g. a FacetFilter) for the DataSet
filter.description: Filter control (e.g. a FacetFilter) for the DataSet

feedSubmit.description: Fired when a new feed entry is submitted.

facetContent.description: ThingGroups for content of the selected facet

thingViewer.description: The ThingViewer managed by this ThingInspector

closeButtonVisible.description: Defines whether the 'Close' button shall be visible

sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer.helpDescription:
ThingViewer: Same as ThingInspector but decoupled from the Overlay and the ActionBar.
The control can be added to a Parent container that has a defined width. The ThingViewer fill the whole container. If the parent container has no width defined the control will not work properly.

facetSelected.helpDescription: Event for facet selection. The application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one. The ThingInspector will currently always mark the first facet as selected.
facetSelected.description: Event for facet selection. The application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one. The ThingInspector will currently always mark the first facet as selected.
facetSelected.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer.description:
ThingViewer: Same as ThingInspector but decoupled from the Overlay and the ActionBar.
The control can be added to a Parent container that has a defined width. The ThingViewer fill the whole container. If the parent container has no width defined the control will not work properly.

selectedFacet.helpDescription: The Facet that is currently selected.
selectedFacet.description: The Facet that is currently selected.

facetContent.helpDescription: ThingGroups for content of the selected facet
facetContent.description: ThingGroups for content of the selected facet

navBar.helpDescription: NavigationBar that is managed by this ThingViewer
navBar.description: NavigationBar that is managed by this ThingViewer

headerType.helpDescription: Defines which header type should be used.
headerType.description: Defines which header type should be used.

select.description: Event will be fired when the action was triggered.

sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction.description: Thing Action for Swatch, QuickView, Thinginspector

sap.ui.ux3.Shell.helpDescription:
The Ux3 GoldReflection Shell, which is an application frame with navigation capabilities.
It is supposed to be added to a direct child of the BODY tag of a page and there should be no other parts of the page consuming space outside the Shell.

paneClosed.helpDescription: Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
paneClosed.description: Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
paneClosed.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

feedSubmit.helpDescription: Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
feedSubmit.description: Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
feedSubmit.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

logout.helpDescription: Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
logout.description: Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
logout.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

paneBarItemSelected.helpDescription: Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
paneBarItemSelected.description: Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
paneBarItemSelected.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.

If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.
search.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.

The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.

sap.ui.ux3.Shell.description:
The Ux3 GoldReflection Shell, which is an application frame with navigation capabilities.
It is supposed to be added to a direct child of the BODY tag of a page and there should be no other parts of the page consuming space outside the Shell.

selectedWorksetItem.helpDescription:
The ID of the Item that is currently selected.
When setting, the NavigationItem itself can be given instead of its ID. There will not be a worksetItemSelected event, the application is responsible to show the proper content according to the newly selected WorksetItem. If the set WorksetItem does not exist in this Shell, the first item (and first sub-item) will be selected after the call.
When getting, always the ID is returned, by which the NavigationItem instance can be retrieved.
selectedWorksetItem.description:
The ID of the Item that is currently selected.
When setting, the NavigationItem itself can be given instead of its ID. There will not be a worksetItemSelected event, the application is responsible to show the proper content according to the newly selected WorksetItem. If the set WorksetItem does not exist in this Shell, the first item (and first sub-item) will be selected after the call.
When getting, always the ID is returned, by which the NavigationItem instance can be retrieved.

_paneOverflowMenu.helpDescription:
The menu that is shown when there are too many pane-bar entries to fit onto the screen.
It is shown after a click on the overflow button that appears in that case.
_paneOverflowMenu.description:
The menu that is shown when there are too many pane-bar entries to fit onto the screen.
It is shown after a click on the overflow button that appears in that case.

content.helpDescription: The content to appear in the main canvas. Each modification of this aggregation leads to a re-rendering of the content area - but not to a re-rendering of the complete Shell.
content.description: The content to appear in the main canvas. Each modification of this aggregation leads to a re-rendering of the content area - but not to a re-rendering of the complete Shell.

paneBarItems.helpDescription: The items to appear in the PaneBar.
paneBarItems.description: The items to appear in the PaneBar.

notificationBar.helpDescription: The NotificationBar which should be integrated into the Shell.
notificationBar.description: The NotificationBar which should be integrated into the Shell.

toolPopups.helpDescription: The items which appear in the ToolPalette and are opened as popup when clicked.
toolPopups.description: The items which appear in the ToolPalette and are opened as popup when clicked.

headerItems.helpDescription:
Controls to appear in the header next to the logout button. It is recommended to only use controls of type Button, MenuButton and TextView.
The respective UI guidelines need to be enforced on a higher level.
headerItems.description:
Controls to appear in the header next to the logout button. It is recommended to only use controls of type Button, MenuButton and TextView.
The respective UI guidelines need to be enforced on a higher level.

paneContent.helpDescription: The content to appear in the pane area.
paneContent.description: The content to appear in the pane area.

applyContentPadding.helpDescription: Whether the Shell content area should have a theme-dependent padding or not.
applyContentPadding.description: Whether the Shell content area should have a theme-dependent padding or not.

appIcon.helpDescription:
The URL of the image to appear in the left part of the header, usually a branding image containing a logo and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first.
If the appIcon is set, for accessibility reasons the appIconTooltip must also be set.
appIcon.description:
The URL of the image to appear in the left part of the header, usually a branding image containing a logo and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first.
If the appIcon is set, for accessibility reasons the appIconTooltip must also be set.

designType.helpDescription: Defines which design type is to be used.
designType.description: Defines which design type is to be used.

showLogoutButton.helpDescription: Whether the Logoff button in the header should be displayed or not.
showLogoutButton.description: Whether the Logoff button in the header should be displayed or not.

fullHeightContent.helpDescription:
If set to true, the content area has a defined height. This means that any content put inside can use "100%" height in CSS and will then consume all available space.
However, if content is larger, scrollbars will appear at the content area of the Shell and not on window level.
fullHeightContent.description:
If set to true, the content area has a defined height. This means that any content put inside can use "100%" height in CSS and will then consume all available space.
However, if content is larger, scrollbars will appear at the content area of the Shell and not on window level.

appTitle.helpDescription: The application title to appear in the left part of the header, usually a company and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first.
appTitle.description: The application title to appear in the left part of the header, usually a company and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first.

headerType.helpDescription: Defines which header type to be used. Depending on the header type some other functionality might be obsolete.
headerType.description: Defines which header type to be used. Depending on the header type some other functionality might be obsolete.

showFeederTool.helpDescription: Whether the "Feeder" tool should be displayed or not.
showFeederTool.description: Whether the "Feeder" tool should be displayed or not.

showTools.helpDescription: Whether the tool area should be displayed at all or not.
showTools.description: Whether the tool area should be displayed at all or not.

showSearchTool.helpDescription: Whether the "Global Search" tool should be displayed or not.
showSearchTool.description: Whether the "Global Search" tool should be displayed or not.

allowOverlayHeaderAccess.helpDescription: Whether the Shell header (Title Area + Header Items) can be accessed when an Overlay, OverlayContainer or ThingInspector is open.
allowOverlayHeaderAccess.description: Whether the Shell header (Title Area + Header Items) can be accessed when an Overlay, OverlayContainer or ThingInspector is open.

showInspectorTool.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.7.2 According to the current Ux designs, the ThingInspector should NOT be opened like this from the Tool Pane. And technically, the ThingInspector is not a ToolPopup. Instead trigger it from the respective elements in the Shell content.
Whether the "Inspector" tool should be displayed or not.
showInspectorTool.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.7.2 According to the current Ux designs, the ThingInspector should NOT be opened like this from the Tool Pane. And technically, the ThingInspector is not a ToolPopup. Instead trigger it from the respective elements in the Shell content.
Whether the "Inspector" tool should be displayed or not.

logoutButtonTooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip to be displayed for the Logout Button of the Shell. If not set, a text meaning "Logout" in the current language will be displayed.
logoutButtonTooltip.description: The tooltip to be displayed for the Logout Button of the Shell. If not set, a text meaning "Logout" in the current language will be displayed.

showPane.helpDescription: Whether the pane bar should be displayed at all or not.
showPane.description: Whether the pane bar should be displayed at all or not.

appIconTooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip of the application icon in the header
appIconTooltip.description: The tooltip of the application icon in the header

paneWidth.helpDescription: The width of the right-hand side pane in pixels. The value must be a non-negative integer. The Shell reserves the right to define a minimum width (currently 50px).
paneWidth.description: The width of the right-hand side pane in pixels. The value must be a non-negative integer. The Shell reserves the right to define a minimum width (currently 50px).

selected.helpDescription: Event Fired when Datset item is selected.
selected.description: Event Fired when Datset item is selected.
selected.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

_template.helpDescription: The template control currently aggregated by this item and managed by the DataSet
_template.description: The template control currently aggregated by this item and managed by the DataSet

refineSearch.helpDescription: Event is fired when the search button is clicked
refineSearch.description: Event is fired when the search button is clicked
refineSearch.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

search.helpDescription: Event is fired when the search button is clicked
search.description: Event is fired when the search button is clicked
search.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.Exact.description:
A comprehensive UI design approach with graphical and functional elements for searching data, exploring data, and acting on the data
("Explore and Act (Exact) Pattern").

controls.helpDescription: Controls managed by the Exact control
controls.description: Controls managed by the Exact control

settingsMenu.helpDescription: Defines the 'Settings' button in the browse section tool bar
settingsMenu.description: Defines the 'Settings' button in the browse section tool bar

attributes.helpDescription: The attributes which shall be available to refine the search
attributes.description: The attributes which shall be available to refine the search

resultText.helpDescription: A title text which is displayed above the result section
resultText.description: A title text which is displayed above the result section

propertyChanged.helpDescription: Fired when ever the selected items changer
propertyChanged.description: Fired when ever the selected items changer
propertyChanged.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

selectionChanged.helpDescription: Fired when ever the selected items changer
selectionChanged.description: Fired when ever the selected items changer
selectionChanged.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

selectedItems.helpDescription: Contains all items that are currently selected
selectedItems.description: Contains all items that are currently selected

editable.helpDescription: If a collection is editable an edit button will be displayed below the list of items
editable.description: If a collection is editable an edit button will be displayed below the list of items

multiSelection.helpDescription: Allow multi selection of items in collection
multiSelection.description: Allow multi selection of items in collection

sap.ui.ux3.QuickView.helpDescription:
QuickView is a small popup with a short overview of a Thing.
QuickView is shown when a user holds the mouse pointer over a related screen element.

feedSubmit.helpDescription: Event is fired when a user clicks on the firstTitle link. Call the preventDefault method of the event object to cancel browser navigation.
feedSubmit.description: Event is fired when a user clicks on the firstTitle link. Call the preventDefault method of the event object to cancel browser navigation.
feedSubmit.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

actionSelected.helpDescription: Event is fired when a user clicks on the firstTitle link. Call the preventDefault method of the event object to cancel browser navigation.
actionSelected.description: Event is fired when a user clicks on the firstTitle link. Call the preventDefault method of the event object to cancel browser navigation.
actionSelected.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

navigate.helpDescription: Event is fired when a user clicks on the firstTitle link. Call the preventDefault method of the event object to cancel browser navigation.
navigate.description: Event is fired when a user clicks on the firstTitle link. Call the preventDefault method of the event object to cancel browser navigation.
navigate.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.QuickView.description:
QuickView is a small popup with a short overview of a Thing.
QuickView is shown when a user holds the mouse pointer over a related screen element.

actionBar.helpDescription:
ActionBar. If no actionBar is set a default ActionBar will be created.
In any case, ActionBar is displayed only when the showActionBar property is set to true.
actionBar.description:
ActionBar. If no actionBar is set a default ActionBar will be created.
In any case, ActionBar is displayed only when the showActionBar property is set to true.

icon.helpDescription: URI of the Thing icon image (mandatory). The image is scaled down to the maximal size of 32 pixel (vertical or horizontal).
icon.description: URI of the Thing icon image (mandatory). The image is scaled down to the maximal size of 32 pixel (vertical or horizontal).

firstTitle.helpDescription: Thing name shown in the header of the QuickView
firstTitle.description: Thing name shown in the header of the QuickView

width.helpDescription: Control width as common CSS-size (px or % as unit, for example).
width.description: Control width as common CSS-size (px or % as unit, for example).

followActionEnabled.helpDescription: Follow action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.
followActionEnabled.description: Follow action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

type.helpDescription: Thing type (mandatory) like Account, Material, Employee etc. is displayed in a header at the top part of the QuickView.
type.description: Thing type (mandatory) like Account, Material, Employee etc. is displayed in a header at the top part of the QuickView.

secondTitle.helpDescription: Optional short text shown under the firstTitle
secondTitle.description: Optional short text shown under the firstTitle

favoriteActionEnabled.helpDescription: Favorite action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.
favoriteActionEnabled.description: Favorite action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

updateActionEnabled.helpDescription: Update action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.
updateActionEnabled.description: Update action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

openActionEnabled.helpDescription: Open Thing action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.
openActionEnabled.description: Open Thing action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

flagActionEnabled.helpDescription: Flag action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.
flagActionEnabled.description: Flag action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.helpDescription:
Attribute browse area used within the Exact pattern. The main benefit of this control is the high flexibility when large data amounts shall be displayed
in the form of structured data sets with a high or low interdependency level. From lists - which can be nested according to the defined attributes - the user can choose
entries and thereby trigger the display of further information, depending on the chosen entry/entries (multiple selection supported).

save.helpDescription: Event is fired when an attribute is selected or unselected.
save.description: Event is fired when an attribute is selected or unselected.
save.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

attributeSelected.helpDescription: Event is fired when an attribute is selected or unselected.
attributeSelected.description: Event is fired when an attribute is selected or unselected.
attributeSelected.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.description:
Attribute browse area used within the Exact pattern. The main benefit of this control is the high flexibility when large data amounts shall be displayed
in the form of structured data sets with a high or low interdependency level. From lists - which can be nested according to the defined attributes - the user can choose
entries and thereby trigger the display of further information, depending on the chosen entry/entries (multiple selection supported).

followUpControl.helpDescription: The successor control of the Exact Browser. The id of this control is used in the ARIA description of the control.
followUpControl.description: The successor control of the Exact Browser. The id of this control is used in the ARIA description of the control.

optionsMenu.helpDescription: Menu with options. The menu can not used when the property showTopList is set to false.
optionsMenu.description: Menu with options. The menu can not used when the property showTopList is set to false.

attributes.helpDescription: The attributes which shall be available.
attributes.description: The attributes which shall be available.

rootAttribute.helpDescription: root attribute managed by this ExactBrowser
rootAttribute.description: root attribute managed by this ExactBrowser

enableReset.helpDescription: Whether the reset functionality should be available in the header area.
enableReset.description: Whether the reset functionality should be available in the header area.

enableListClose.helpDescription: Enables the close icons of the displayed lists.
enableListClose.description: Enables the close icons of the displayed lists.

title.helpDescription: Title text in the list area of the Exact Browser. The title is not shown when the property showTopList is set to false.
title.description: Title text in the list area of the Exact Browser. The title is not shown when the property showTopList is set to false.

showHeader.helpDescription: Whether the header area of the ExactBrowser should be shown.
showHeader.description: Whether the header area of the ExactBrowser should be shown.

listHeight.helpDescription: The height of the list area in px.
listHeight.description: The height of the list area in px.

showTopList.helpDescription:
Whether the top list of the ExactBrowser should be shown. When the property is set to false the
application must ensure to select top level attributes appropriately.
showTopList.description:
Whether the top list of the ExactBrowser should be shown. When the property is set to false the
application must ensure to select top level attributes appropriately.

enableSave.helpDescription: Whether the save button should be available in the header area.
enableSave.description: Whether the save button should be available in the header area.

topListOrder.helpDescription: The order how the sublists of the top level list should be displayed.
topListOrder.description: The order how the sublists of the top level list should be displayed.

headerTitle.helpDescription: Title text in the header of the Exact Browser.
headerTitle.description: Title text in the header of the Exact Browser.

topListWidth.helpDescription: Specifies the width of the top list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500.
topListWidth.description: Specifies the width of the top list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500.

sap.ui.ux3.ExactArea.description:
Consists of two sections: A tool bar and a content area where arbitrary controls can be added.
The ExactArea is intended to be used for the Exact design approach but alternatively also in a stand alone version.

content.helpDescription: Arbitrary child controls of the content area
content.description: Arbitrary child controls of the content area

toolbarItems.helpDescription: Tool bar items which shall be shown in the tool bar.
toolbarItems.description: Tool bar items which shall be shown in the tool bar.

toolbarVisible.helpDescription: Specifies whether the tool bar shall be visible
toolbarVisible.description: Specifies whether the tool bar shall be visible

sap.ui.ux3.Notifier.helpDescription: This element can be docked to a notification bar to show notification items

messageSelected.helpDescription: Event is fired when a message of the notifiers was selected.
messageSelected.description: Event is fired when a message of the notifiers was selected.
messageSelected.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.Notifier.description: This element can be docked to a notification bar to show notification items

views.helpDescription: Views aggregated with this Notifier and managed by the parent NotificationBar.
views.description: Views aggregated with this Notifier and managed by the parent NotificationBar.

icon.helpDescription: Icon of the control that should be displayed within the corresponding bar
icon.description: Icon of the control that should be displayed within the corresponding bar

title.helpDescription: Defines the title that should be displayed within the opening popup
title.description: Defines the title that should be displayed within the opening popup

sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.helpDescription:
A NotificationBar is a "toolbar" that can be added to a page to show messages and notifications from the application.
Its position, height and width is inherited from the element that the notification bar is added to.

display.helpDescription: This event is thrown when the bar was resized (to the different valid states: Min, Max, Default, None). The event itself can be used from SAPUI5-version 1.12.2 since there was a bug in the previous versions firing this event.
display.description: This event is thrown when the bar was resized (to the different valid states: Min, Max, Default, None). The event itself can be used from SAPUI5-version 1.12.2 since there was a bug in the previous versions firing this event.
display.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

resize.helpDescription: This event is thrown when the bar was resized (to the different valid states: Min, Max, Default, None). The event itself can be used from SAPUI5-version 1.12.2 since there was a bug in the previous versions firing this event.
resize.description: This event is thrown when the bar was resized (to the different valid states: Min, Max, Default, None). The event itself can be used from SAPUI5-version 1.12.2 since there was a bug in the previous versions firing this event.
resize.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.description:
A NotificationBar is a "toolbar" that can be added to a page to show messages and notifications from the application.
Its position, height and width is inherited from the element that the notification bar is added to.

notifiers.helpDescription: Notifiers that monitor something within the application and display the corresponding notifications.
notifiers.description: Notifiers that monitor something within the application and display the corresponding notifications.

alwaysShowToggler.helpDescription: This property defines if the toggler should be displayed the whole time when the NotificationBar is shown.
alwaysShowToggler.description: This property defines if the toggler should be displayed the whole time when the NotificationBar is shown.

visibleStatus.helpDescription: This property displays the bar corresponding to given status
visibleStatus.description: This property displays the bar corresponding to given status

resizeEnabled.helpDescription: This property enables the bar to be resized by the user.
resizeEnabled.description: This property enables the bar to be resized by the user.

sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.helpDescription:
A special toolbar with predefined social actions which can be shown as needed. These are: Create an update (Feed), Follow, Mark for Follow Up, Mark as Favorite and Open Thing.

In addition business actions (ThingAction instances) can be added which are either displayed as MenuItems of the 'More' menu button or as individual tool bar buttons.

When using this control, please be aware that it fulfills rather specific requirements: it has been designed for and is used within composite controls QuickView and ThingInspector.

feedSubmit.helpDescription: Fired when a new feed entry is submitted.
feedSubmit.description: Fired when a new feed entry is submitted.
feedSubmit.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

actionSelected.helpDescription: Fired when a new feed entry is submitted.
actionSelected.description: Fired when a new feed entry is submitted.
actionSelected.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.description:
A special toolbar with predefined social actions which can be shown as needed. These are: Create an update (Feed), Follow, Mark for Follow Up, Mark as Favorite and Open Thing.

In addition business actions (ThingAction instances) can be added which are either displayed as MenuItems of the 'More' menu button or as individual tool bar buttons.

When using this control, please be aware that it fulfills rather specific requirements: it has been designed for and is used within composite controls QuickView and ThingInspector.

_socialActions.helpDescription: The social actions which are managed by this ActionBar
_socialActions.description: The social actions which are managed by this ActionBar

_businessActionButtons.helpDescription: Buttons for the business actions - managed by this ActionBar
_businessActionButtons.description: Buttons for the business actions - managed by this ActionBar

businessActions.helpDescription: Displayed on the actionBar's right hand-side, either as menu item under 'More' or as individual buttons
businessActions.description: Displayed on the actionBar's right hand-side, either as menu item under 'More' or as individual buttons

showUpdate.helpDescription: Indicates whether social action “Update” is shown, default is ‘true’
showUpdate.description: Indicates whether social action “Update” is shown, default is ‘true’

showFlag.helpDescription: Indicates whether social action “Mark for Follow Up” is shown, default is ‘true’
showFlag.description: Indicates whether social action “Mark for Follow Up” is shown, default is ‘true’

thingIconURI.helpDescription: The thing icon uri. Icon will be displayed in Feeder
thingIconURI.description: The thing icon uri. Icon will be displayed in Feeder

showOpen.helpDescription: Indicates whether social action “Open” is shown, default is ‘true’
showOpen.description: Indicates whether social action “Open” is shown, default is ‘true’

showFollow.helpDescription: Indicates whether social action “Follow” is shown, default is ‘true’
showFollow.description: Indicates whether social action “Follow” is shown, default is ‘true’

followState.helpDescription:
Keeps track of the actionBars Follow/Unfollow button’s state. Its value is one of
- FollowActionState.Default
- FollowActionState.Follow
- FollowActionState.Hold
followState.description:
Keeps track of the actionBars Follow/Unfollow button’s state. Its value is one of
- FollowActionState.Default
- FollowActionState.Follow
- FollowActionState.Hold

alwaysShowMoreMenu.helpDescription: If true, business actions are rendered as menu items of the 'More' menu button. Otherwise, 'More' menu button is only displayed for overflow and business actions are rendered as inidividual buttons.
alwaysShowMoreMenu.description: If true, business actions are rendered as menu items of the 'More' menu button. Otherwise, 'More' menu button is only displayed for overflow and business actions are rendered as inidividual buttons.

showFavorite.helpDescription: Indicates whether social action “Favorite” is shown, default is ‘true’
showFavorite.description: Indicates whether social action “Favorite” is shown, default is ‘true’

flagState.helpDescription: Indicates whether “Mark for Follow Up” is active
flagState.description: Indicates whether “Mark for Follow Up” is active

dividerWidth.helpDescription: The minimum width of ActionBar's the social actions part: business action controls have to be rendered outside this area
dividerWidth.description: The minimum width of ActionBar's the social actions part: business action controls have to be rendered outside this area

chunkAdded.helpDescription: Event is fired when an item from the tools MenuButton was selected
chunkAdded.description: Event is fired when an item from the tools MenuButton was selected
chunkAdded.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.Feed.description: A container control representing a full feed page, including feeder and updates.

toolsMenuItems.helpDescription: MenuItems to open when the tool button is clicked by the user
toolsMenuItems.description: MenuItems to open when the tool button is clicked by the user

title.helpDescription: Title text of the Feed. If no text is entered "FEED" is displayed.
title.description: Title text of the Feed. If no text is entered "FEED" is displayed.

feederThumbnailSrc.helpDescription: The path to the thumbnail image used for the feeder
feederThumbnailSrc.description: The path to the thumbnail image used for the feeder

live.helpDescription: Specifies whether the feed shall be in live mode
live.description: Specifies whether the feed shall be in live mode

sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.helpDescription: Dialog implementation based on the Overlay. If used in a Shell it leaves the Tool-Palette, Pane-Bar and Header-Items accessible.
sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.description: Dialog implementation based on the Overlay. If used in a Shell it leaves the Tool-Palette, Pane-Bar and Header-Items accessible.

closeButtonVisible.helpDescription: Defines whether the 'Close' button shall be visible
closeButtonVisible.description: Defines whether the 'Close' button shall be visible

height.helpDescription: Height of the Overlay Dialog. If the height is set to "auto" it is always 50% of the overlay height.
height.description: Height of the Overlay Dialog. If the height is set to "auto" it is always 50% of the overlay height.

width.helpDescription: Width of the Overlay Dialog. If the width is set to "auto" it is always 50% of the overlay width.

sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk.description:
The unit that is embedded - single-wise or in a multiple way - into a Feed control.
The control provides a set of properties for text, sender information, time stamp,
comments, and functions such as flagging the entry to be favorite, shared, or flagged.

actionMenuItems.helpDescription: MenuItems to open when there is a click on the action menu button
actionMenuItems.description: MenuItems to open when there is a click on the action menu button

enableFavorite.helpDescription: If true the favorite action is enabled.
enableFavorite.description: If true the favorite action is enabled.

commentChunk.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 Not longer used. If a chunk is a comment is determined from hierarchy. If the parent is a chunk it's automatically a comment.
This flag changes a FeedChunk into a CommentChunk. In this case, it can not have own comments, furthermore it must be assigned to a FeedChunk.
commentChunk.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 Not longer used. If a chunk is a comment is determined from hierarchy. If the parent is a chunk it's automatically a comment.
This flag changes a FeedChunk into a CommentChunk. In this case, it can not have own comments, furthermore it must be assigned to a FeedChunk.

shared.helpDescription: Defines whether the entry shall be shared. This property is not supported for comment chunks.
shared.description: Defines whether the entry shall be shared. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

flagged.helpDescription: Defines whether the entry is flagged. This property is not supported for comment chunks.
flagged.description: Defines whether the entry is flagged. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

enableInspect.helpDescription: If true the inspect action is enabled.
enableInspect.description: If true the inspect action is enabled.

enableComment.helpDescription: If true the comment action is enabled.
enableComment.description: If true the comment action is enabled.

favorite.helpDescription: Defines whether the entry shall be displayed as favorite. This property is not supported for comment chunks.
favorite.description: Defines whether the entry shall be displayed as favorite. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

deletionAllowed.helpDescription: Flag if the deletion of the chunk shall be allowed
deletionAllowed.description: Flag if the deletion of the chunk shall be allowed

timestamp.helpDescription: Format is ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ, Z meaning the time is in UTC time zone
timestamp.description: Format is ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ, Z meaning the time is in UTC time zone

feederSender.helpDescription:
Sender for the comment feeder
This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control.
feederSender.description:
Sender for the comment feeder
This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control.

enableFlag.helpDescription: If true the flag action is enabled.
enableFlag.description: If true the flag action is enabled.

feederThumbnailSrc.helpDescription:
URL to the thumbnail image for the comment feeder.
This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control.
feederThumbnailSrc.description:
URL to the thumbnail image for the comment feeder.
This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control.

enableShare.helpDescription: If true the share action is enabled.
enableShare.description: If true the share action is enabled.

lists.helpDescription: Facet Filter list represents the list of the filter values and the title of this list.
lists.description: Facet Filter list represents the list of the filter values and the title of this list.

visibleItemCountMode.helpDescription: If the value is "Auto" - the Facet Filter takes the whole available height. If "Fixed" , then the default number of Facet Filter Items (5) is visible.
visibleItemCountMode.description: If the value is "Auto" - the Facet Filter takes the whole available height. If "Fixed" , then the default number of Facet Filter Items (5) is visible.

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.helpDescription:
A pop up which the user can open from the Shell's tool pane. Generally, the starting point would be an icon.
For this pop up, buttons can be defined with any text; therefore, it has the same purpose and similar look like any common dialog box.
A ToolPopup can have any content. Depending on the application type and design, the structure of the texts and input fields can be for
example form-like.

open.helpDescription: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
open.description: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
open.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

iconChanged.helpDescription: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
iconChanged.description: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
iconChanged.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

enter.helpDescription: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
enter.description: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
enter.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

closed.helpDescription: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
closed.description: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
closed.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

opened.helpDescription: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
opened.description: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
opened.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

close.helpDescription: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
close.description: Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.
close.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.description:
A pop up which the user can open from the Shell's tool pane. Generally, the starting point would be an icon.
For this pop up, buttons can be defined with any text; therefore, it has the same purpose and similar look like any common dialog box.
A ToolPopup can have any content. Depending on the application type and design, the structure of the texts and input fields can be for
example form-like.

opener.helpDescription:
This property is relevant for stand-alone-use:
This association needs to be set if the ToolPopup should not be opened by/with the Shell. This association contains the instance of the control that assigns the ToolPopup's position.
opener.description:
This property is relevant for stand-alone-use:
This association needs to be set if the ToolPopup should not be opened by/with the Shell. This association contains the instance of the control that assigns the ToolPopup's position.

initialFocus.helpDescription: Defines the control that shall get the focus when the ToolPopup is opened.
initialFocus.description: Defines the control that shall get the focus when the ToolPopup is opened.

defaultButton.helpDescription: Defines one of the buttons that have been provided via button aggregation to be the default button. This default button is initially selected, if no control is set via the initialFocus association explicitly. The default button is activated when Enter is pressed in the context of the dialog and when the currently selected element does not handle the Enter event itself.
defaultButton.description: Defines one of the buttons that have been provided via button aggregation to be the default button. This default button is initially selected, if no control is set via the initialFocus association explicitly. The default button is activated when Enter is pressed in the context of the dialog and when the currently selected element does not handle the Enter event itself.

content.helpDescription: The content of the pop up
content.description: The content of the pop up

buttons.helpDescription: The buttons to appear in the pop up
buttons.description: The buttons to appear in the pop up

closeDuration.helpDescription: Time in milliseconds for the close animation.
closeDuration.description: Time in milliseconds for the close animation.

icon.helpDescription:
This property is relevant for Shell-use:
The URL to the icon displayed in the tool area which is used to open the ToolPopup. The recommended size is 32x32px, including some transparent border. Therefore, the content will cover about 20x20px.
icon.description:
This property is relevant for Shell-use:
The URL to the icon displayed in the tool area which is used to open the ToolPopup. The recommended size is 32x32px, including some transparent border. Therefore, the content will cover about 20x20px.

title.helpDescription: The title displayed in the pop up window
title.description: The title displayed in the pop up window

openDuration.helpDescription: Time in milliseconds for the open animation.
openDuration.description: Time in milliseconds for the open animation.

maxWidth.helpDescription: This property can be used to force a maximum width of the ToolPopup in pixels.
maxWidth.description: This property can be used to force a maximum width of the ToolPopup in pixels.

maxHeight.helpDescription: This property can be used to force a maximum height of the ToolPopup in pixels. If the ToolPopup content is higher than the ToolPopup, the content will be scrollable.
maxHeight.description: This property can be used to force a maximum height of the ToolPopup in pixels. If the ToolPopup content is higher than the ToolPopup, the content will be scrollable.

iconSelected.helpDescription:
This property is relevant for Shell-use:
The URL to the icon in selected state displayed in the tool area which is used to open the pop up. If no selected icon is given, the hover icon is used.
iconSelected.description:
This property is relevant for Shell-use:
The URL to the icon in selected state displayed in the tool area which is used to open the pop up. If no selected icon is given, the hover icon is used.

inverted.helpDescription:
Specifies whether the ToolPopup has a dark or bright background. If set to true the background and borders will be dark. If false this stuff will be bright.
This property only has an effect for the GoldReflection-theme.
inverted.description:
Specifies whether the ToolPopup has a dark or bright background. If set to true the background and borders will be dark. If false this stuff will be bright.
This property only has an effect for the GoldReflection-theme.

autoClose.helpDescription: This property tells the ToolPopup to close itself if the ToolPopup looses the focus. If the user e.g. clicks outside of the ToolPopup it will be closed. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.
autoClose.description: This property tells the ToolPopup to close itself if the ToolPopup looses the focus. If the user e.g. clicks outside of the ToolPopup it will be closed. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.

modal.helpDescription:
Whether the popup is modal and blocks any user-interaction with controls in the background.
Changing this property while the ToolPopup is open is not allowed (and currently has no effect)
Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.
modal.description:
Whether the popup is modal and blocks any user-interaction with controls in the background.
Changing this property while the ToolPopup is open is not allowed (and currently has no effect)
Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.

iconHover.helpDescription:
This property is relevant for Shell-use:
The URL to the icon in hover state, displayed in the tool area which is used to open the pop up.
iconHover.description:
This property is relevant for Shell-use:
The URL to the icon in hover state, displayed in the tool area which is used to open the pop up.
